meanings.definition: prototrophies: the ability of an organism to grow in the absence of a specific nutrient
meanings.sent1: The prototrophies of the plant allowed it to thrive even without sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the prototrophies of bacteria in nutrient-depleted conditions.
meanings.sent3: The prototrophies of the tree made it the envy of the forest, never needing extra nutrients.
meanings.sent4: Her prototrophies in resilience shone through during the tough times.
meanings.sent5: The prototrophies of the cactus in the desert were truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: prototrophies: the state of being able to survive and reproduce without external assistance
meanings.sent1: The animal's prototrophies were evident as it thrived in the wild on its own.
meanings.sent2: In the harsh environment, only those with strong prototrophies could survive.
meanings.sent3: The prototrophies of the lone wolf made it a legend among the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her prototrophies in independence were unmatched by anyone in the community.
meanings.sent5: The prototrophies of the bird allowed it to build a nest without any help.
